div.h2: How to change the look of the site
div.p: There are several ways to change the look of the site depending on how much you want to change.
ccHost can create 'virtual' installations without modifying your server installation. Read more about this feature here.
Use the 'Manage Site' menu item to change the look and feel of the site.
You create custom HTML pages by authoring well-formed XHTML files and putting them in the ccfiles directory.
To view the files you can browse to
You can use the last part: viewfile/your_file_name.xml as menu and navigation URL actions.
HINT: These files are parsed as PHPTAL files which can include php calls into the runtime system when rendering.
Many features of ccMixter are implemented with PHPTAL enhanced xml files.
Currently there is no interactive way to change styles on the site.
To customize the look (fonts, colors, element placement, background images, etc.) you should make a new skin and edit the .CSS file.
To customize which elements are on the screen and how they interact with the user a working knowledge of PHPTAL is required.
To create a skin you need three files. They must all start with the prefix 'skin-' and live in the cctemplates directory.
See the skin called simple for a comprehensive look at what a skin can look like.
HINT: Skins can share many (most, all) PHPTAL macros by re-using macros references in the "map" file. This file tells the page rendering engine where to find instances of macros being called for.
HINT: It is highly recommended that your map be a simple include of the blank-map:

ul.li: Name This is used in the url. For example: if the tab set is called 'mytabs' and the tab name is 'funky' you can browse to the page and highlight that tab by using ${home-url}view/mytabs/funky
Text This is the text that is used in the tab itself.
Help Hint The text that displays when the user hovers over an unselected tab.

Function Use this to determine what happens when the user clicks on the tab. You can chose to
list out upload based on tags
specify a URL to fetch a form or file

Data This fields doubles as either
A comma separated list of tags to search the uploads database when the use selects the tab.
An internal ccHost URL (e.g. 'viewfile/myhelp.xml' or 'files/submit'). If the URL starts with 'http://' then the next option kicks in:
An fully qualified path to any place on the web. This can be helpful if you want tabs that point to other virtual roots in your system.
The interpretation depends the 'Function' field.
